definition: to reassign sb to a different job/to turn around/to change direction/to make a U turn
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: Every time he saw a lawyer walking along the road, he would swerve to hit him.
sentences.chinese: 每当他看见有律师在路边走，他就会调转车头撞过去。

sentences.english: I back my car up to the next pump, hurry to get away from her.
sentences.chinese: 为了躲她远点，我匆匆调转车头向下一个油泵驶去。

sentences.english: When the angle is small, the saturation control is replaced by the reverse square root control.
sentences.chinese: 小角度调转时用反向开方代替饱和控制的三模态控制。

sentences.english: At this point the players have to modulate from E to G.
sentences.chinese: 这时演奏者必须由E调转到G调。

sentences.english: The stentorian voice, the timbre is exquisite, can turn on lathe the palace to transfer, 12 law sound accompaniments are prepared.
sentences.chinese: 声音宏亮，音色优美，能旋宫调转，十二律伴音齐备。

sentences.english: He decided to turn this research on its head by studying young healthy men.
sentences.chinese: 他决定调转研究方向，研究健康的年轻人。

sentences.english: At the end of this phrase, the music modulates from C to G.
sentences.chinese: 这个乐句结束时，音乐从C调转为G调。

sentences.english: The quartermaster swung the ship into the wind and laid it by.
sentences.chinese: 舵工调转船头使船顶风停下。

sentences.english: Here the music modulates from E to G.
sentences.chinese: 音乐在这儿从E调转到G调。

sentences.english: Then he turned and started marching back behind it.
sentences.chinese: 然后他调转方向并且开始跟在李的后面行进。

sentences.english: The ship came about and headed for the shore.
sentences.chinese: 轮船调转般向朝海岸驶去。

sentences.english: We must make a turn at the next street.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在下一个街口调转车头。

definition: to turn around
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
tone (of voice)/tune
variant of 掉頭|掉头[diao4 tou2]
to turn one's head/to turn round/to turn about
horse's head/same as 碼頭|码头[ma3 tou2], pier
to charge into
to rush out
to charge forward
facing forwards
to rotate/to turn round/slalom
to revolve/to rotate/rotation
to run away/to flee in disarray
to aim at/to target/to point at/to be directed at/registration/alignment (mechanical engineering)
top speed/at full speed
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to speed along
to make prompt decisions (idiom)
